Ester Sigrid Augusta Jan&son. G. 36 m. Signe Lind. — Studrex. i Södertälje 24, med. kand. v. Karol. inst. 28, med. lic. där 33. Förordn. .s. provrläk. i Västanhede o. Karlstads las. med. avd. 37, ord. förste und rläk. där 37, även tf. las rläk. där, flygläk. av första gr. 40.
translated:
Lundvik, Vilhelm Göran, county governor, former minister, Vänersborg, born on August 28, 1883 at Næs Ironworks, Norway, son of Carl-Johan L. and Ebba Simp-ler. Married 1st in 1915 to Karin Alfthan, died in 1919; 2nd in 1922 to Dagmar Lamm. Children: Ulf born in 1916. Divorced in Gävle in 1902, graduated with a Bachelor of Arts in Uppsala in 1906, graduated with a Bachelor of Laws there in 1912. Attaché in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 1912, secretary of the Parliamentary Constitutional Committee in 1913 and 1914, of the Legal Committee from 1915, and of the Municipal Tax Committee from 1915 to 1916; representative of the Ironworks Association from 1916 to 1919, commercial attaché and counselor at the Swedish Embassy in Paris from 1919 to 1925, also at the Swedish Embassy in Brussels from 1921 to 1925; given the title of commercial counselor in 1926, acting undersecretary of state in the Ministry of Trade from 1925 to 1926, minister and head of the Ministry of Trade from October 2, 1928 to June 7, 1930, executive director in the Swedish Travel Industry Association from 1926 to 1941, county governor of Älvsborg County since 1941. Secretary of the Swedish representation in the international committee for the administration of Schleswig during the referendum and chairman of the referendum bureau in 1920, member and correspondent member of the Economic Commission of the League of Nations from 1930 to 1933, vice chairman of the 1932 Trade Commission; member of the Railway Council from 1932 to 1943, of the Treaty Committee since 1932, vice chairman since 1936, member of the Cultural Council since 1935, of the State Trade Committee since 1939, chairman since 1945, chairman of the Southern Household Association of Älvsborg County since 1943 and of the Northern Household Association since 1945. Member of the Swedish Technical Association since 1927. Grand Cross of the Order of the North Star, Commander of the Order of Vasa, Knight of the Order of St. John, Grand Officer of the Order of the Crown of Belgium, Commander with Star of the Order of the Finnish White Rose, Knight of the Order of the Polar Star, Member of the Order of the Sword with Olgr leaf cluster, Knight First Class of the Order of the Dannebrog. 

*Luthman, Gustaf Arne, flight doctor, Såtenäs, born on July 16, 1905 in Södertälje, son of Per Gustaf L. and Ester Sigrid Augusta Jan&son. Married in 1936 to Signe Lind. Studied in Södertälje until 1924, received his Bachelor of Medicine degree from Karolinska Institute in 1928 and his medical license in 1933. Appointed as probationary doctor in Västanhede and Söderköping districts, as assistant doctor in Linköping hospital's medical department, as temporary assistant doctor at Söder Görans Hospital's dermatovenereology department, and as junior physician at Hässleby sanatorium in 1933. Became a general practitioner at Marieberg Hospital in 1934, assistant doctor and temporary senior doctor for four months at Garphyttan sanatorium in 1935, temporary junior physician and temporary senior doctor at Karlstad hospital's medical department from 1937 to 1939, permanent senior doctor at Karlstad hospital from 1939; also acted as temporary chief medical officer there. Flight doctor of the first group since 1940.

organization.name: Swedish Representation in International Committee for Administration of Schleswig
